intro: Blandfordia × flammea-elegans, commonly known as the flame lily or red lily, is a striking evergreen perennial native to the coastal regions of New South Wales, Australia. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its long, strap-like leaves and showy, pendulous flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically blooms in late summer to early autumn, producing clusters of tubular flowers that attract nectar-feeding birds and insects. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires a cool, moist environment to flourish. Blandfordia × flammea-elegans is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is well-suited to coastal and subtropical climates.
